t: In the Amazon, a U.N. Agency Has a Green Mission, but Dirty Partners (Published 2022)
s: August 11, 2022 - RESGUARDO BUENAVISTA, Colombia ... Amazon, in an Indigenous village surrounded by oil rigs, the Siona people faced a dilemma. The United Nations Development Program, or U.N.D.P., had just announced a $1.9 million regional aid package. In a village with no running water, intermittent electricity and persistent poverty, any money would mean food and opportunity. But the aid program was part of a partnership between the United Nations agency and GeoPark, the multinational petroleum ...
